snippet: With 11 states branded with an F, StudentsFirst, led by the former schools chancellor in Washington, D.C., would seem to be building a reputation as a harsh grader.
abstract: StudentsFirst, advocacy group led by Michelle A Rhee, issues report grading states on how closely they follow group's education platform, giving 12 states lowest grade of F.
lead_paragraph: With 11 states branded with an F, StudentsFirst, led by the former schools chancellor in Washington, D.C., would seem to be building a reputation as a harsh grader.

headline.seo: StudentsFirst Issues Low Ratings on School Policies
headline.main: 11 States Get Failing Grades on Public School Policies From Advocacy Group
headline.print_headline: 12 States Get Failing Grades on Public School Policies From Advocacy Group
